patch 8.2.0440: terminal noblock test is still very flaky on BSD

Problem:    Terminal noblock test is still very flaky on BSD.
Solution:   Increase the waiting time.

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0440: terminal noblock test is still very flaky on BSD · vim/vim@d06dbf3

patch 8.2.0431: some compilers don't support using \e for Esc

Problem:    Some compilers don't support using \e for Esc. (Yegappan
            Lakshmanan)
Solution:   use \033 instead.

attachments.text: Problem: Some compilers don't support using \e for Esc. (Yegappan Lakshmanan) Solution: use \033 instead.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/a8bd3496380ceb32e544dfe39cb4d52e4943068c|patch 8.2.0434: MS-Windows with VTP: Normal color not working>
patch 8.2.0434: MS-Windows with VTP: Normal color not working

Problem:    MS-Windows with VTP: Normal color not working.
Solution:   After changing the Normal color update the VTP console color.
            (Nobuhiro Takasaki, closes #5836)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0434: MS-Windows with VTP: Normal color not working · vim/vim@a8bd349
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0434: MS-Windows with VTP: Normal color not working · vim/vim@a8bd349
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows with VTP: Normal color not working. Solution: After changing the Normal color update the VTP console color. (Nobuhiro Takasaki, closes #5836)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/dbbb0ef729e392e313ccc63c247bff1b828a214d|patch 8.2.0435: channel contents might be freed twice>
patch 8.2.0435: channel contents might be freed twice

Problem:    Channel contents might be freed twice.
Solution:   Call either channel_free_channel() or channel_free(), not both.
            (Nobuhiro Takasaki, closes #5835)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0435: channel contents might be freed twice · vim/vim@dbbb0ef
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0435: channel contents might be freed twice · vim/vim@dbbb0ef
attachments.text: Problem: Channel contents might be freed twice. Solution: Call either channel_free_channel() or channel_free(), not both. (Nobuhiro Takasaki, closes #5835)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d7b7770f11c16cfac707b5048c61e722dcc903a6|patch 8.2.0438: terminal noblock test is very flaky on BSD>
patch 8.2.0438: terminal noblock test is very flaky on BSD

Problem:    Terminal noblock test is very flaky on BSD.
Solution:   Change WaitFor() to WaitForAssert() to be able to see why it
            failed.  Add a short wait in between sending keys.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0438: terminal noblock test is very flaky on BSD · vim/vim@d7b7770
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0438: terminal noblock test is very flaky on BSD · vim/vim@d7b7770
attachments.text: Problem: Terminal noblock test is very flaky on BSD. Solution: Change WaitFor() to WaitForAssert() to be able to see why it failed. Add a short wait in between sending keys.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1082772f4c29bceebf5eb06f7e1f01bd143a2131|patch 8.2.0439: :disassemble has minor flaws>
patch 8.2.0439: :disassemble has minor flaws

Problem:    :disassemble has minor flaws.
Solution:   Format the code.  Use (int) instead of (char) for %c.
            (also by James McCoy, closes #5831)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0439: :disassemble has minor flaws · vim/vim@1082772
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0439: :disassemble has minor flaws · vim/vim@1082772
attachments.text: Problem: :disassemble has minor flaws. Solution: Format the code. Use (int) instead of (char) for %c. (also by James McCoy, closes #5831)
